name: 4,5,6,7-tetrachloro-2-phenyl-1,3-benzodioxole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1978
Reason: 4,5,6,7-tetrachloro-2-phenyl-1,3-benzodioxole has a melting point that can be predicted by considering the functional groups present in the molecule. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The phenyl group in the molecule increases the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. Each phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 30°C to the melting point. The chlorine atoms also contribute to the melting point due to their ability to participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the molecular weight. Each chlorine atom can be estimated to add approximately 10°C to the melting point. The presence of multiple chlorine atoms can increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the potential for hydrogen bonding.
